body_html:
back to my issue: --input_meta_graph_def should be --input_meta_graph

Yet, it means that a call like:

python freeze_graph.py \
--input_checkpoint=/path/min-validation_error.data-00000-of-00001 \
--output_graph=/tmp/frozen_graph.pb \
--output_node_names=super/cool/result

will fail with obscure 'ValueError("No variables to save")'. This can be improved
body_text:
back to my issue: --input_meta_graph_def should be --input_meta_graph
Yet, it means that a call like:
python freeze_graph.py \
--input_checkpoint=/path/min-validation_error.data-00000-of-00001 \
--output_graph=/tmp/frozen_graph.pb \
--output_node_names=super/cool/result

will fail with obscure 'ValueError("No variables to save")'. This can be improved
body:
back to my issue: --input_meta_graph_def should be --input_meta_graph

Yet, it means that a call like:
```
python freeze_graph.py \
--input_checkpoint=/path/min-validation_error.data-00000-of-00001 \
--output_graph=/tmp/frozen_graph.pb \
--output_node_names=super/cool/result
```
will fail with obscure 'ValueError("No variables to save")'. This can be improved
